knob.name: FirmwareConfiguration
knob.description: Firmware Configuration options. NOTE:Ignore Policy Update(STR_FW_CONFIG_DEFAULT_VALUE) is to skip policy update and will ONLY WORK ON A PLATFORM.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Firmware Configuration

knob.name: XmlCliSupport
knob.description: Enable Disable Xml Cli Support in BIOS
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Xml Cli Support

knob.name: PublishSetupPgPtr
knob.description: Publish Setup page Pointer in BIOS Knobs section of the Xml File
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Publish Setup page Pointer

knob.name: LoadValidationFv
knob.description: Load Sv Validation FV to boot to F6
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Load Validation FV

knob.name: PlatformDriverSupport
knob.description: Force installing the protocol
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Install Platform Driver

knob.name: UsbTypeCAicSupport
knob.description: Enable/Disable USB Type C Support
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Type C Support

knob.name: OsDebugPort
knob.description: Select Kernel Debug Port and report in ACPI DBG2 table
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Kernel Debug Serial Port

knob.name: PlatformDebugConsent
knob.description: To ?opt-in? for debug, please select ?Enabled? with the desired debug probe type. Enabling this BIOS option may alter the default value of other debug-related BIOS options. Note: DCI OOB (aka BSSB) uses CCA probe; [DCI OOB+DbC] and [USB2 DbC] have the same setting.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Platform Debug Consent

knob.name: DciUsb3TypecUfpDbg
knob.prompt: USB3 Type-C UFP2DFP Kernel/Platform Debug Support
knob.description: This BIOS option enables kernel and platform debug for USB3 interface over a UFP Type-C receptacle, select ?No Change? will do nothing to UFP2DFP setting
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/USB3 Type-C UFP2DFP Kernel/Platform Debug Support

knob.name: SlpS0Override
knob.description: Select ?Auto?, it will be auto-configured according to probe type. Select ?Enabled? will disable SLP_S0# assertion whereas ?Disabled? will enable SLP_S0# assertion when debug is enabled. Note: This BIOS option should keep ?Auto?, other options are intended for advanced configuration only.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/SLP_S0# Override

knob.name: SlpS0DisQForDebug
knob.description: Select ?Auto?, it will be auto-configured according to probe type. ?No Change? will keep PMC default settings. Or select the desired debug probe type for S0ix Override settings. Reminder: USB3 DbC supports S0 only. DCI OOB (aka BSSB) uses CCA probe. Note: This BIOS option should keep ?Auto?, other options are intended for advanced configuration only.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/S0ix Override Settings

knob.name: PchEnableDbcObs
knob.description: This option overrides USB Over Current enablement state that USB OC will be disabled after enabling this option. Enable when DbC is used to avoid signaling conflicts.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/USB Overcurrent Override for DbC

knob.name: DebugInterfaceEnable
knob.description: Enable/Disable CPU Run Control Support
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/CPU Run Control

knob.name: DebugInterfaceLockEnable
knob.description: Enable/Disable CPU Run Control Lock
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/CPU Run Control Lock

knob.name: PchTraceHubMode
knob.description: Select ?Host Debugger? if Trace Hub is used with host debugger tool or ?Target Debugger? if Trace Hub is used by target debugger software. Note: If ?Host Debugger? is selected, Platform Debug Consent has to be ENABLED because DCI is one of the primary trace data output paths.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/PCH Trace Hub Enable Mode

knob.name: PchTraceHubMemReg0Size
knob.description: Select size of memory region 0 buffer. Choose None/OS if OS-supported memory or trace forwarding is desired. Note : Limitation of total buffer size (PCH + CPU) is 512MB
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/PCH TH Mem Buffer Size 0

knob.name: PchTraceHubMemReg1Size
knob.description: Select size of memory region 1 buffer. Choose None/OS if OS-supported memory or trace forwarding is desired. Note : Limitation of total buffer size (PCH + CPU) is 512MB
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/PCH TH Mem Buffer Size 1

knob.name: ProcessorTraceMemSize
knob.description: Disable or Select Processor trace memory region Size: from 4KB ~ 128MB
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/Processor trace memory allocation

knob.name: ProcessorTraceEnable
knob.description: Enable/Disable processor trace feature from CPU MSR. Enabling this feature will immediately start trace collection.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/Processor trace

knob.name: ProcessorTraceOutputScheme
knob.description: Select Single Range Output scheme or ToPA table Output scheme
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/Processor Trace OutPut Scheme

knob.name: JtagC10PowerGateDisable
knob.description: When Enabled, JTAG is power gated in C10 state. When Disabled, keeps the JTAG power up during C10 and deeper power states for debug purpose.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/JTAG C10 Power Gate

knob.name: ThreeStrikeCounterDisable
knob.description: Enable/Disable Three Strike Counter
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/Three Strike Counter

knob.name: EnableCrashLog
knob.description: The feature helps collecting crash data from PMC SSRAM
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/CrashLog Feature

knob.name: CrashLogOnAllReset
knob.description: Option to invoke CrashLog collection on all reset
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/CrashLog On All Reset

knob.name: PmcDbgMsgEn
knob.description: When Enabled, PMC HW will send debug messages to trace hub; When Disabled, PMC HW will never send debug meesages to trace hub. Noted: When Enabled, may not enter S0ix
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/PMC Debug Message Enable

knob.name: CpuWakeupTimer
knob.description: Enable/Disable long CPU wakeup timer. When enabled, the internal cpu wakeup timer is increased from 8 seconds to 180 seconds.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/CPU Wakeup Timer

knob.name: DelayedAuthenticationMode
knob.description: Enable/Disable Delayed Authentication Mode
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Debug Settings/Advanced Debug Settings/Delayed Authentication Mode

knob.name: OpRomPost
knob.description: In case of multiple Option ROMs (Legacy and EFI Compatible), specifies what PCI Option rom to launch.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCI Subsystem Settings/PCI ROM Priority

knob.name: ExternalDma
knob.description: External DMA Allowed On Boot for devices such as 1394, PCMCIA, n CardBus
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCI Subsystem Settings/External DMA Allowed On Boot

knob.name: PciLatency
knob.description: Value to be programmed into PCI Latency Timer Register.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCI Subsystem Settings/PCI Latency Timer

knob.name: AcpiAuto
knob.description: Enables or Disables BIOS ACPI Auto Configuration.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/Enable ACPI Auto Configuration

knob.name: AcpiHibernate
knob.description: Enables or Disables System ability to Hibernate (OS/S4 Sleep State). This option may not be effective with some OSs.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/Enable Hibernation

knob.name: PtidSupport
knob.description: PTID Support will be loaded if enabled.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PTID Support

knob.name: PeciAccessMethod
knob.description: PECI Access Method is Direct I/O or ACPI
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PECI Access Method

knob.name: AcpiSleepState
knob.description: Enable ACPI S3 support
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/ACPI S3 Support

knob.name: PciExpNative
knob.description: Bit - PCIe Native * control 0 - ~ Hot Plug 1 - SHPC Native Hot Plug control 2 - ~ Power Management Events 3 - PCIe Advanced Error Reporting control 4 - PCIe Capability Structure control 5 - Latency Tolerance Reporting control
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/Native PCIE Enable

knob.name: NativeAspmEnable
knob.description: Enabled - OS Controlled ASPM, Disabled - BIOS Controlled ASPM
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/Native ASPM

knob.name: GuidForward
knob.description: Forward PPI/Protocol Guid, status code to scratch
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/Guid Forward

knob.name: WakeOnRTCS5
knob.prompt: Wake System from S5 via RTC
knob.description: Enable or disable System wake on alarm event. When enabled, System will wake on the hr::min::sec specified/Programmed by the Tools from OS.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/Wake System from S5 via RTC

knob.name: AcpiDebug
knob.description: Open a memory buffer for storing debug strings. Reenter SETUP after enabling to see the buffer address. Use method ADBG to write strings to buffer.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/ACPI Debug

knob.name: SerialPortAcpiDebug
knob.description: Print copy of ACPI debug logs to serial port
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/ Print to Serial Port

knob.name: LowPowerS0Idle
knob.description: This variable determines if we enable ACPI Lower Power S0 Idle Capability (Mutually exclusive with Smart connect). While this is enabled, it also disable 8254 timer for SLP_S0 support.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/Low Power S0 Idle Capability

knob.name: PuisEnable
knob.description: Enable/Disable Power-Up In Standby (PUIS) feature set allows devices to be powered-up into the Standby power management state to minimize inrush current at power-up and to allow the host to sequence the spin-up of devices.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PUIS Enable

knob.name: CSNotifyEC
knob.description: Sends EC notification of Low Power S0 Idle State
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/EC Notification

knob.name: CSDebugLightEC
knob.description: When EC enters Low Power S0 Idle State, the CAPS LOCK light will be turned on
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/EC CS Debug Light

knob.name: EcLowPowerMode
knob.description: This option controls whether EC will go to Low power mode during Low Power S0 Idle State
knob.depex: Sif( LowPowerS0Idle _NEQ_ 1 ) _AND_ Sif( CSNotifyEC _NEQ_ 1 ) _AND_ Sif( NoEcLowPowerExitGpio _EQU_ 1 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/EC Low Power Mode

knob.name: SensorStandby
knob.description: Enable/Disable Sensor standby mode
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/Sensor Standby

knob.name: PL1LimitCS
knob.description: Limit PL1 (Power Limit 1) while in Connected Standby
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/CS PL1 Limit

knob.name: PL1LimitCSValue
knob.description: PL1 value is in milliwatts with 125 step value
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/CS PL1 Value

knob.name: LpitResidencyCounter
knob.description: Select Residency Counter
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/Lpit Residency Counter

knob.name: IrmtConfiguration
knob.description: Enable/Disable Ready Mode support based on Windows Away-mode. Only on DT/AIO.
knob.depex: Sif( ( Rtd3Support _EQU_ 0x0 OR ( ( PlatformFlavor _NEQ_ 0x2 ) AND ( PlatformFlavor _NEQ_ 0x1 ) ) ) )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/Intel Ready Mode Technology

knob.name: LoadSSDTFromFile
knob.description: SSDT table from file
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/SSDT table from file

knob.name: PciDelayOptimizationEcr
knob.description: Experimental ACPI additions for FW latency optimizations
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PCI Delay Optimization

knob.name: EnableMsiInFadt
knob.description: When disabled, MSI support is disabled in FADT
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/MSI enabled

knob.name: PepCpu
knob.description: Add CPU in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP CPU

knob.name: PepGfx
knob.description: Add Gfx in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP Graphics

knob.name: PepIpu
knob.description: Add IPU in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP IPU

knob.name: PepPeg0
knob.description: Add PEG0 in PEP Constraint list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP PEG0

knob.name: PepSataContraints
knob.description: Add Storage device in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP SATA

knob.name: PepSataEnumeration
knob.description: Add enumerated SATA ports in PEP Constraint list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP enumerated SATA ports

knob.name: PepPcieStorage
knob.description: Add PCIe Storage devices in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP PCIe Storage

knob.name: PepUart
knob.description: Add UART in PEP mitigation list
knob.depex: Sif( LowPowerS0Idle _NEQ_ 1 ) _AND_ Gif( PchSerialIoDevice_9 _EQU_ 0 AND PchSerialIoDevice_10 _EQU_ 0 AND PchSerialIoDevice_11 _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP UART

knob.name: PepI2c0
knob.description: Adds I2C in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP I2C0

knob.name: PepI2c1
knob.description: Adds I2C in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP I2C1

knob.name: PepI2c2
knob.description: Adds I2C in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP I2C2

knob.name: PepI2c3
knob.description: Adds I2C in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP I2C3

knob.name: PepI2c4
knob.description: Adds I2C in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP I2C4

knob.name: PepI2c5
knob.description: Adds I2C in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP I2C5

knob.name: PepSpi
knob.description: Add SPI in PEP mitigation list
knob.depex: Sif( LowPowerS0Idle _NEQ_ 1 ) _AND_ Gif( PchSerialIoDevice_6 _EQU_ 0 AND PchSerialIoDevice_7 _EQU_ 0 AND PchSerialIoDevice_8 _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP SPI

knob.name: PepXhci
knob.description: Add XHCI in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP XHCI

knob.name: PepAudio
knob.description: Add Audio in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP Audio

knob.name: PepEmmc
knob.description: Add EMMC in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP EMMC

knob.name: PepSdxc
knob.description: Add SDXC in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP SDXC

knob.name: PepCsme
knob.description: Add CSME in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP CSME

knob.name: PepGbe
knob.description: Add LAN(GBE) in PEP mitigation list
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP LAN(GBE)

knob.name: PepTbt
knob.description: Add TBT RP in PEP mitigation list
knob.depex: Sif( LowPowerS0Idle _NEQ_ 1 ) _AND_ Gif( DiscreteTbtSupport _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Gif( Rtd3Tbt _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/ACPI Settings/PEP Constraints Configuration/PEP TBT RP

knob.name: EnableC6Dram
knob.description: Enable/Disable moving of DRAM contents to PRM memory when CPU is in C6 state
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/C6DRAM

knob.name: EnableSgx
knob.description: Enable/Disable Software Guard Extensions (SGX)
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Software Guard Extensions (SGX)

option.text: Software Guard Extensions Enabled And PRMRR Base is BIOS Defined,Feature MSR will set SGX bit and ACPI table will reflect EPC values, but BIOS will not load SGX patch

knob.name: EpcLength
knob.description: Manually setting EPC length inside PRMRR region
knob.depex: Sif( SgxSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( FirmwareConfiguration _NEQ_ 5 ) _AND_ Sif( EnableSgx _NEQ_ 3 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/EPC length

knob.name: EpcOffset
knob.description: EPC offset from PRMRR base
knob.depex: Sif( SgxSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( FirmwareConfiguration _NEQ_ 5 ) _AND_ Sif( EnableSgx _NEQ_ 3 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/EPC offset

knob.name: EpochUpdate
knob.description: There are three Owner EPOCH modes (Each EPOCH is 64bit): no change in owner epoch, change to new random owner epoch and manually entered by user. After generating new epoch via ?Change to New Random Owner EPOCHs?, the selection reverts back to ?No Change in Owner Epochs?, this is to ensure Epoch stays same, across Sx states. After the user enters epoch values manually, the values will not be visible, for security reasons.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Select Owner EPOCH input type

option.text: Change to New Random Owner EPOCHs

knob.name: SgxLCP
knob.description: Software Guard Extensions (SGX) Launch Control Policy. Options are: Intel Locked - Select Intel?s Launch Enclave. Unlocked - Enable OS/VMM configuration of Launch Enclave. Locked - Allow owner to configure Launch Enclave.
knob.depex: Sif( SgxSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( EnableSgx _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( FirmwareConfiguration _NEQ_ 5 ) _AND_ Sif( SgxLaunchControlSupported _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/SGX Launch Control Policy

knob.name: SgxLEPubKeyHash0
knob.description: Bytes 0 - 7 of Software Guard Extensions (SGX) Launch Enclave Public Key Hash
knob.depex: Sif( SgxSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( EnableSgx _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( FirmwareConfiguration _NEQ_ 5 ) _AND_ Sif( SgxLaunchControlSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( SgxLCP _NEQ_ 2 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/SGX LE Public Key Hash 0

knob.name: SgxLEPubKeyHash1
knob.description: Byte 8 - 15 of Software Guard Extensions (SGX) Launch Enclave Public Key Hash
knob.depex: Sif( SgxSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( EnableSgx _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( FirmwareConfiguration _NEQ_ 5 ) _AND_ Sif( SgxLaunchControlSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( SgxLCP _NEQ_ 2 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/SGX LE Public Key Hash 1

knob.name: SgxLEPubKeyHash2
knob.description: Bytes 16 - 23 of Software Guard Extensions (SGX) Launch Enclave Public Key Hash
knob.depex: Sif( SgxSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( EnableSgx _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( FirmwareConfiguration _NEQ_ 5 ) _AND_ Sif( SgxLaunchControlSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( SgxLCP _NEQ_ 2 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/SGX LE Public Key Hash 2

knob.name: SgxLEPubKeyHash3
knob.description: Bytes 24 - 31 of Software Guard Extensions (SGX) Launch Enclave Public Key Hash
knob.depex: Sif( SgxSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( EnableSgx _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( FirmwareConfiguration _NEQ_ 5 ) _AND_ Sif( SgxLaunchControlSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( SgxLCP _NEQ_ 2 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/SGX LE Public Key Hash 3

knob.name: PrmrrSize
knob.description: Setting the PRMRR Size
knob.depex: Sif( ( ( EnableSgx _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( ( ( EnableSgx _EQU_ 2 ) AND ( PrmrrSize _EQU_ 0x0 ) ) )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/PRMRR Size

knob.name: SvReserveMemoryBelowPrmrr
knob.description: Enable/Disable memory reservation below PRMRR region for SV use
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Reserve memory below PRMRR

knob.name: CpuRatioOverride
knob.description: Enable/Disable CPU Flex Ratio Programming
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/CPU Flex Ratio Override

knob.name: CpuRatio
knob.description: This value must be between Max Efficiency Ratio (LFM) and Maximum non-turbo ratio set by Hardware (HFM).
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/CPU Flex Ratio Settings

knob.name: HwPrefetcher
knob.description: To turn on/off the MLC streamer prefetcher.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Hardware Prefetcher

knob.name: AclPrefetch
knob.description: To turn on/off prefetching of adjacent cache lines.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Adjacent Cache Line Prefetch

knob.name: VT
knob.description: When enabled, a VMM can utilize the additional hardware capabilities provided by Vanderpool Technology.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Intel (VMX) Virtualization Technology

knob.name: Peci
knob.description: Enable/Disable PECI
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/PECI

knob.name: ActiveCoreCount
knob.description: Number of cores to enable in each processor package.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Active Processor Cores

knob.name: HyperThreading
knob.description: Enabled or Disabled Hyper-Threading Technology.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Hyper-Threading

knob.name: BistOnReset
knob.description: Enable/Disable BIST (Built-In Self Test) on reset
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/BIST

knob.name: ApIdleManner
knob.description: AP threads Idle Manner for waiting signal to run
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/AP threads Idle Manner

knob.name: AES
knob.description: Enable/Disable AES (Advanced Encryption Standard)
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/AES

knob.name: ForceUnlockAES
knob.description: Enable the Unlock of MSR_IA32_FEATURE_CONFIG
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Force Unlock AES

knob.name: MachineCheck
knob.description: Enable/Disable Machine Check
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/MachineCheck

knob.name: MonitorMwait
knob.description: Enable/Disable MonitorMWait
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/MonitorMWait

knob.name: Txt
knob.description: Enables utilization of additional hardware capabilities provided by Intel (R) Trusted Execution Technology. Changes require a full power cycle to take effect.
knob.depex: Sif( TXTAvailable _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Gif( VT _EQU_ 0 OR ( ( FirmwareConfiguration _NEQ_ 5 ) AND dTpm12Present _EQU_ 0 AND dTpm20Present _EQU_ 0 ) OR EnableVtd _EQU_ 0 OR ActiveCoreCount _NEQ_ 0 OR ( HyperThreading _EQU_ 0 AND HTAvailable _EQU_ 1 ) )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Intel Trusted Execution Technology

knob.name: AcheckRequest
knob.description: Enables Txt Alias Checking capability Changes require full Txt capability before it will take effect. It is a one time only change, next reboot will be reset.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Alias Check Request

knob.name: DprSize
knob.description: Reserve DPR memory size (0-255) MB
knob.depex: Sif( TXTAvailable _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Gif( LtDprProgramming _EQU_ 1 OR ( dTpm12Present _EQU_ 0 AND dTpm20Present _EQU_ 0 ) OR VT _EQU_ 0 OR EnableVtd _EQU_ 0 OR Txt _EQU_ 0 OR ActiveCoreCount _NEQ_ 0 OR ( HyperThreading _EQU_ 0 AND HTAvailable _EQU_ 1 ) )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/DPR Memory Size (MB)

knob.name: ResetAux
knob.description: Reset TPM Aux content. Txt may not functional after AUX content gets reset.
knob.depex: Sif( TXTAvailable _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Gif( LtDprProgramming _EQU_ 1 OR ( ( dTpm12Present _EQU_ 0 OR TpmCurrentState _NEQ_ 2 ) AND dTpm20Present _EQU_ 0 ) OR VT _EQU_ 0 OR EnableVtd _EQU_ 0 OR Txt _EQU_ 1 OR ActiveCoreCount _NEQ_ 0 OR ( HyperThreading _EQU_ 0 AND HTAvailable _EQU_ 1 ) )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Reset AUX Content

knob.name: EpocFclkFreq
knob.prompt: FCLK Frequency for Early Power On
knob.description: FCLK frequency can take values of 400MHz, 800MHz and 1GHz (1GHz not supported for ULT/ULX SKUs)
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/FCLK Frequency for Early Power On

knob.name: LlcWaysEnable
knob.description: Dynamic LLC sizing settings Enable
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Dynamic LLC Sizing Enable

knob.name: LlcWays
knob.description: Dynamic LLC sizing settings
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Dynamic LLC Sizing

knob.name: VoltageOptimization
knob.description: Auto: This Option will honor the Silicon default values; ENABLE - Mobile SKU?s, DISABLE - Rest of all SKUs other than Mobile
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/Voltage Optimization

knob.name: BiosGuard
knob.description: Configure BIOS Guard feature. Options are: DISABLE - Disable BIOS Guard Feature; ENABLE - Enable BIOS Guard Feature. NOTE: This option should not be present on Production System
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/BIOS Guard/BIOS Guard

knob.name: BiosGuardModuleSelection
knob.description: Select CRB or SV BIOS Guard Module
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/BIOS Guard/BIOS Guard Module Selection

knob.name: BiosGuardToolsInterface
knob.description: Configure Tools Interface. Options are: DISABLE - Disable Tools Interface; ENABLE - Enable Tools Interface.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/CPU Configuration/BIOS Guard/Enable Tools Interface

knob.name: HwpInterruptControl
knob.prompt: Intel(R) Speed Shift Technology Interrupt Control
knob.description: Enable/Disable Intel(R) Speed Shift Technology Interrupts
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/Intel(R) Speed Shift Technology Interrupt Control

knob.name: BootFrequency
knob.description: Select the performance state that the BIOS will set starting from reset vector.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Boot performance mode

knob.name: EnableGv
knob.description: Allows more than two frequency ranges to be supported.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Intel(R) SpeedStep(tm)

knob.name: RaceToHalt
knob.description: Enable/Disable Race To Halt feature. RTH will dynamically increase CPU frequency in order to enter pkg C-State faster to reduce overall power. (RTH is controlled through MSR 1FC bit 20)
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Race To Halt (RTH)

knob.name: EnableHwp
knob.description: Enable/Disable Intel(R) Speed Shift Technology support. Enabling will expose the CPPC v2 interface to allow for hardware controlled P-states.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Intel(R) Speed Shift Technology

knob.name: EnableItbm
knob.description: Enable/Disable Intel(R) Turbo Boost Max Technology 3.0 support. Disabling will report the maximum ratio of the slowest core in _CPC object.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Intel(R) Turbo Boost Max Technology 3.0

knob.name: EnableItbmDriver
knob.prompt: Intel(R) Turbo Boost Max Technology 3.0 Driver
knob.description: Enable/Disable Intel(R) Turbo Boost Max Technology 3.0 driver. Enable will load the driver upon ACPI device with HID - INT3510.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Intel(R) Turbo Boost Max Technology 3.0 Driver

knob.name: HdcControl
knob.description: This option allows HDC configuration. Disabled: Disable HDC Enabled: Can be enabled by OS if OS native support is available.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/HDC Control

knob.name: TurboMode
knob.description: Enable/Disable processor Turbo Mode (requires Intel Speed Step or Intel Speed Shift to be available and enabled).
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Turbo Mode

knob.name: PlatformPowerLimit1Enable
knob.description: Enable/Disable Platform Power Limit 1 programming. If this option is enabled, it activates the PL1 value to be used by the processor to limit the average power of given time window.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Platform PL1 Enable

knob.name: PlatformPowerLimit1Power
knob.description: Platform Power Limit 1 Power in Milli Watts. BIOS will round to the nearest 1/8W when programming. Any value can be programmed between Max and Min Power Limits (specified by PACKAGE_POWER_SKU_MSR). For 12.50W, enter 12500. This setting will act as the new PL1 value for the Package RAPL algorithm.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Platform PL1 Power

knob.name: PlatformPowerLimit1Time
knob.description: Platform Power Limit 1 Time Window value in seconds. The value may vary from 0 to 128. 0 - default values. Indicates the time window over which Platform TDP value should be maintained.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Platform PL1 Time Window

knob.name: PlatformPowerLimit2Enable
knob.description: Enable/Disable Platform Power Limit 2 programming. If this option is disabled, BIOS will program the default values for Platform Power Limit 2.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Platform PL2 Enable

knob.name: PlatformPowerLimit2Power
knob.description: Platform Power Limit 2 Power in Milli Watts. BIOS will round to the nearest 1/8W when programming. Any value can be programmed between Max and Min Power Limits (specified by PACKAGE_POWER_SKU_MSR). For 12.50W, enter 12500. This setting will act as the new PL2 value for the Package RAPL algorithm.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Platform PL2 Power

knob.name: PowerLimit4Override
knob.description: Enable/Disable Power Limit 4 override. If this option is disabled, BIOS will leave the default values for Power Limit 4.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Power Limit 4 Override

knob.name: PowerLimit4
knob.description: Power Limit 4 in Milli Watts. BIOS will round to the nearest 1/8W when programming. For 12.50W, enter 12500. If the value is 0, BIOS leaves default value
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Power Limit 4

knob.name: PowerLimit4Lock
knob.description: Power Limit 4 MSR 601h Lock. When enabled PL4 configurations are locked during OS. When disabled PL4 configuration can be changed during OS.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Power Limit 4 Lock

knob.name: EnableCx
knob.description: Enable/Disable CPU Power Management. Allows CPU to go to C states when it?s not 100% utilized.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/C states

knob.name: EnableC1e
knob.description: Enable/Disable C1E. When enabled, CPU will switch to minimum speed when all cores enter C-State.
knob.depex: Sif( CxAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR EnableCx _EQU_ 0 OR C1EAvailable _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ Enhanced C-states

knob.name: CStateAutoDemotion
knob.description: Configure C-State Auto Demotion
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ C-State Auto Demotion

knob.name: CStateUnDemotion
knob.description: Configure C-State Un-demotion
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ C-State Un-demotion

knob.name: PkgCStateDemotion
knob.description: Package C-State Demotion
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ Package C-State Demotion

knob.name: PkgCStateUnDemotion
knob.description: Package C-State Un-demotion
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ Package C-State Un-demotion

knob.name: CStatePreWake
knob.description: Disable - Sets bit 30 of POWER_CTL MSR(0x1FC) to 1 to disable the Cstate Pre-Wake
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CState Pre-Wake

knob.name: PmgCstCfgCtrIoMwaitRedirection
knob.description: When set, will map IO_read instructions sent to IO registers PMG_IO_BASE_ADDRBASE+offset to MWAIT(offset)
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/IO MWAIT Redirection

knob.name: PkgCStateLimit
knob.description: Maximum Package C State Limit Setting. Cpu Default: Leaves to Factory default value.Auto: Initializes to deepest available Package C State Limit.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Package C State Limit

knob.name: CstateLatencyControl0TimeUnit
knob.description: Unit of measurement for IRTL value - bits [12:10]
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Time Unit

knob.name: CstateLatencyControl0Irtl
knob.description: Interrupt Response Time Limit value- bits [9:0], Enter 0-1023
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Latency

knob.description: Unit of measurement for IRTL value - bits [12:10]
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Time Unit

knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Latency

knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Latency

knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Latency

knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Time Unit

knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Latency

knob.description: Unit of measurement for IRTL value - bits [12:10]
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Time Unit

knob.name: CstateLatencyControl5Irtl
knob.description: Interrupt Response Time Limit value- bits [9:0], Enter 0-1023
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Latency

knob.name: EnableThermalMonitor
knob.description: Enable/Disable Thermal Monitor
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Thermal Monitor

knob.name: InterruptRedirectMode
knob.description: Interrupt Redirection Mode Select for Logical Interrupts
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Interrupt Redirection Mode Selection

knob.name: TimedMwait
knob.description: Enable/Disable Timed MWAIT Support
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Timed MWAIT

knob.name: EcTurboControlMode
knob.description: Enable/Disable EC Turbo Control mode
knob.depex: Sif( ( ( PlatformFlavor _NEQ_ 0x1 ) AND ( PlatformFlavor _NEQ_ 0x5 ) ) OR TurboMode _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/EC Turbo Control Mode

knob.name: AcBrickCapacity
knob.description: Specify the AC Brick capacity
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ AC Brick Capacity

knob.name: EcPollingPeriod
knob.description: Count 1 to 255 for a range of 10ms to 2.55 seconds (1 count - 10ms)
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ EC Polling Period

knob.name: EcGuardBandValue
knob.description: Count 1 to 20 for a range of 1 watt to 20 watts
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ EC Guard Band Value

knob.name: EcAlgorithmSel
knob.description: Count 1 to 10 for Algorithm Selection
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ EC Algorithm Selection

knob.name: EpgEnable
knob.description: Enable/disable Energy Performance Gain.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Energy Performance Gain

knob.name: Idd3n
knob.description: Active standby current (Idd3N) in milliamps from datasheet. Must be calculated on a per DIMM basis.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/EPG DIMM Idd3N

knob.name: Idd3p
knob.description: Active power-down current (Idd3P) in milliamps from datasheet. Must be calculated on a per DIMM basis.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/EPG DIMM Idd3P

knob.description: Sets the number of custom P-states. At least 2 states must be present.

knob.name: EnergyEfficientPState
knob.description: Enable/Disable Energy Efficient P-state feature. When set to 0, will disable access to ENERGY_PERFORMANCE_BIAS MSR and CPUID Function 6 ECX[3] will read 0 indicating no support for Energy Efficient policy setting. When set to 1 will enable access to ENERGY_PERFORMANCE_BIAS MSR 1B0h and CPUID Function 6 ECX[3] will read 1 indicating Energy Efficient policy setting is supported.
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) OR PlatformFlavor _EQU_ 0x4 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ View/Configure Turbo Options/Energy Efficient P-state

knob.name: TurboPowerLimitLock
knob.description: Enable/Disable locking of Package Power Limit settings. When enabled, PACKAGE_POWER_LIMIT MSR will be locked and a reset will be required to unlock the register.
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) OR PlatformFlavor _EQU_ 0x4 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ View/Configure Turbo Options/Package Power Limit MSR Lock

knob.name: LongDurationPwrLimitOverride
knob.description: Enable/Disable Power Limit 1 override. If this option is disabled, BIOS will program the default values for Power Limit 1 and Power Limit 1 Time Window.
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( ConfigTdpAvailable _EQU_ 1 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ View/Configure Turbo Options/Power Limit 1 Override

knob.name: PowerLimit1
knob.description: Power Limit 1 in Milli Watts. BIOS will round to the nearest 1/8W when programming. 0 - no custom override. For 12.50W, enter 12500. Overclocking SKU: Value must be between Max and Min Power Limits (specified by PACKAGE_POWER_SKU_MSR). Other SKUs: This value must be between Min Power Limit and TDP Limit. If value is 0, BIOS will program TDP value.
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( ConfigTdpAvailable _EQU_ 1 OR LongDurationPwrLimitOverride _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ View/Configure Turbo Options/Power Limit 1

knob.name: PowerLimit1Time
knob.description: Power Limit 1 Time Window value in seconds. The value may vary from 0 to 128. 0 - use default value (28 sec). Defines time window which TDP value should be maintained.
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( ConfigTdpAvailable _EQU_ 1 OR LongDurationPwrLimitOverride _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ View/Configure Turbo Options/Power Limit 1 Time Window

knob.name: PowerLimit2
knob.description: Enable/Disable Power Limit 2 override. If this option is disabled, BIOS will program the default values for Power Limit 2.
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( ConfigTdpAvailable _EQU_ 1 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ View/Configure Turbo Options/Power Limit 2 Override

knob.name: PowerLimit2Power
knob.description: Power Limit 2 value in Milli Watts. BIOS will round to the nearest 1/8W when programming. If the value is 0, BIOS will program this value as 1.25*TDP. For 12.50W, enter 12500. Processor applies control policies such that the package power does not exceed this limit.
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( ConfigTdpAvailable _EQU_ 1 OR PowerLimit2 _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ View/Configure Turbo Options/Power Limit 2

knob.name: RatioLimit1
knob.description: 1-Core Ratio Limit with range of (Max Non-Turbo Ratio - 255). Min - Max Non-Turbo Ratio. Max - fused turbo ratio, or 255 if CPU is unlocked for overclocking. This 1-Core Ratio Limit must be greater than or equal all other ratio values.
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( CoreRatioLimitAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR EnableGv _EQU_ 0 OR TurboMode _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ View/Configure Turbo Options/1-Core Ratio Limit Override

knob.name: RatioLimit2
knob.description: 2-Core Ratio Limit with range of (Max Non-Turbo Ratio - 255). Min - Max Non-Turbo Ratio. Max - fused turbo ratio, or 255 if CPU is unlocked for overclocking. This 2-Core Ratio Limit Must be ?- to 1-Core Ratio Limit.
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( CoreRatioLimitAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR EnableGv _EQU_ 0 OR TurboMode _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( NumCores _LT_ 2 OR ( ( ActiveCoreCount _LT_ 2 ) AND ( ActiveCoreCount _NEQ_ 0 ) ) )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ View/Configure Turbo Options/2-Core Ratio Limit Override

knob.description: 3-Core Ratio Limit with range of (Max Non-Turbo Ratio - 255). Min - Max Non-Turbo Ratio. Max - fused turbo ratio, or 255 if CPU is unlocked for overclocking. This 3-Core Ratio Limit Must be ?- to 1-Core Ratio Limit.
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( CoreRatioLimitAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR EnableGv _EQU_ 0 OR TurboMode _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( NumCores _LT_ 3 OR ( ( ActiveCoreCount _LT_ 3 ) AND ( ActiveCoreCount _NEQ_ 0 ) ) )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ View/Configure Turbo Options/3-Core Ratio Limit Override

knob.name: RatioLimit4
knob.description: 4-Core Ratio Limit with range of (Max Non-Turbo Ratio - 255). Min - Max Non-Turbo Ratio. Max - fused turbo ratio, or 255 if CPU is unlocked for overclocking. This 4-Core Ratio Limit Must be ?- to 1-Core Ratio Limit.
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( CoreRatioLimitAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR EnableGv _EQU_ 0 OR TurboMode _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( NumCores _LT_ 4 OR ( ( ActiveCoreCount _LT_ 4 ) AND ( ActiveCoreCount _NEQ_ 0 ) ) )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ View/Configure Turbo Options/4-Core Ratio Limit Override

knob.description: 5-Core Ratio Limit with range of (Max Non-Turbo Ratio - 255). Min - Max Non-Turbo Ratio. Max - fused turbo ratio, or 255 if CPU is unlocked for overclocking. This 5-Core Ratio Limit Must be ?- to 1-Core Ratio Limit.
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( CoreRatioLimitAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR EnableGv _EQU_ 0 OR TurboMode _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( NumCores _LT_ 5 OR ( ( ActiveCoreCount _LT_ 5 ) AND ( ActiveCoreCount _NEQ_ 0 ) ) )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ View/Configure Turbo Options/5-Core Ratio Limit Override

knob.description: 6-Core Ratio Limit with range of (Max Non-Turbo Ratio - 255). Min - Max Non-Turbo Ratio. Max - fused turbo ratio, or 255 if CPU is unlocked for overclocking. This 6-Core Ratio Limit Must be ?- to 1-Core Ratio Limit.
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( CoreRatioLimitAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR EnableGv _EQU_ 0 OR TurboMode _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( NumCores _LT_ 6 OR ( ( ActiveCoreCount _LT_ 6 ) AND ( ActiveCoreCount _NEQ_ 0 ) ) )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ View/Configure Turbo Options/6-Core Ratio Limit Override

knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) ) _AND_ Sif( CoreRatioLimitAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR EnableGv _EQU_ 0 OR TurboMode _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( NumCores _LT_ 7 OR ( ( ActiveCoreCount _LT_ 7 ) AND ( ActiveCoreCount _NEQ_ 0 ) ) )

knob.name: EnergyEfficientTurbo
knob.description: Enable/Disable Energy Efficient Turbo Feature. This feature will opportunistically lower the turbo frequency to increase efficiency. Recommended only to disable in overclocking situations where turbo frequency must remain constant. Otherwise, leave enabled.
knob.depex: Sif( ( TurboModeAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR ( EnableGv _EQU_ 0 AND EnableHwp _EQU_ 0 ) ) )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ View/Configure Turbo Options/Energy Efficient Turbo

knob.name: VrPowerDeliveryDesign
knob.description: Specifies the CFL-S board design used for the VR settings override values. By default, BIOS will override the default CFL-S VR settings based on the board design. A value of AUTO(0) will use the board ID to determine the board design. Any other value will override the board id logic to provide a custom VR Power Delivery Design value. This is intended primarily for validation.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/VR Power Delivery Design

knob.name: PsysSlope
knob.description: PSYS Slope defined in 1/100 increments. Range is 0-200. For a 1.25 slope, enter 125. 0 - AUTO. Uses BIOS VR mailbox command 0x9.?
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/PSYS Slope

knob.name: PsysOffset
knob.description: PSYS Offset defined in 1/4 increments. Range is 0-255. For an offset of 25, enter 100. Uses BIOS VR mailbox command 0x9.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/PSYS Offset

knob.name: PsysPmax
knob.description: PSYS PMax power, defined in 1/8 Watt increments. Range 0-8192. For a PMax of 125W, enter 1000. 0 - AUTO. Uses BIOS VR mailbox command 0xB.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/PSYS PMax Power

knob.name: IslVrCmd
knob.description: VR Mailbox command to fix Intersil VR C-state issues. Disabled- No Mailbox command sent. Default is Disabled.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/Intersil VR Command

knob.name: AcousticNoiseMitigation
knob.description: Enabling this option will help mitigate acoustic noise on certain SKUs when the CPU is in deeper C state. This needs to be enabled to program PreWake, Ramp Up and Ramp Down times.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/Acoustic Noise Settings/Acoustic Noise Mitigation

knob.name: PreWake
knob.description: Set the maximum Pre Wake randomization time in micro ticks. Range is 0-255. This is for acoustic noise mitigation Dynamic Perodicity Alteration (DPA) tuning.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/Acoustic Noise Settings/Pre Wake Time

knob.name: RampUp
knob.description: Set the maximum Ramp Up randomization time in micro ticks. Range is 0-255. This is for acoustic noise mitigation Dynamic Perodicity Alteration (DPA) tuning.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/Acoustic Noise Settings/Ramp Up Time

knob.name: RampDown
knob.description: Set the maximum Ramp Down randomization time in micro ticks. Range is 0-255. This is for acoustic noise mitigation Dynamic Perodicity Alteration (DPA) tuning.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/Acoustic Noise Settings/Ramp Down Time

knob.name: FastPkgCRampDisableIa
knob.prompt: Disable Fast PKG C State Ramp for IA Domain
knob.description: This option needs to be configured to reduce acoustic noise during deeper C states. False: Don?t disable Fast ramp during deeper C states; True: Disable Fast ramp during deeper C state
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/Acoustic Noise Settings/Disable Fast PKG C State Ramp for IA Domain

knob.description: Set VR IA Slow Slew Rate for Deep Package C State ramp time; Slow slew rate equals to Fast divided by number, the number is 2, 4, 8, 16 to slow down the slew rate to help minimize acoustic noise
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/Acoustic Noise Settings/Slow Slew Rate for IA Domain

knob.name: FastPkgCRampDisableGt

knob.description: Set VR SA Slow Slew Rate for Deep Package C State ramp time; Slow slew rate equals to Fast devided by number, the number is 2, 4, 8, 16 to slow down the slew rate to help minimize acoustic noise
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/Acoustic Noise Settings/Slow Slew Rate for SA Domain

knob.name: McivrRfiFrequencyAdjust
knob.description: Unexpected Clock Frequency!
knob.depex: Sif( McivrSupported _EQU_ 0 AND FivrSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( McivrSupported _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/RFI Settings/RFI Frequency Adjustment

knob.name: McivrRfiFrequencyPrefix
knob.description: ?+? prefix will move OPVR Center Frequency higher than nominal, 139.5MHz. ?-? prefix will move OPVR Center Frequency lower than nominal, 139.5MHz.
knob.depex: Sif( McivrSupported _EQU_ 0 AND FivrSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( McivrSupported _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/RFI Settings/RFI Frequency Prefix

knob.name: McivrSpreadSpectrum
knob.description: Adjustment for OPVR RFI Spread Spectrum to mitigate EMI risk. Spread spectrum values are defined as center spread and total spread %. Default is 1.5%. Additional OPVR EMI reduction can be achieved by increasing RFI Spread Spectrum % value. The use of spread Spectrum % value larger than 1.5% may introduce Wi-Fi RFI. Check Wi-Fi (2.4GHz-2.5GH) RFI condition.
knob.depex: Sif( McivrSupported _EQU_ 0 AND FivrSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( McivrSupported _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/RFI Settings/RFI Spread Spectrum

knob.name: FivrRfiFrequency
knob.description: Set desired RFI frequency, in increments of 100KHz. (For a frequency of 100.6MHz, enter 1006.)
knob.depex: Sif( McivrSupported _EQU_ 0 AND FivrSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( FivrSupported _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/RFI Settings/RFI Frequency

knob.name: FivrSpreadSpectrum
knob.description: Adjustment for OPVR RFI Spread Spectrum to mitigate EMI risk. Spread spectrum values are defined as center spread and total spread %. Default is 1.5%. Additional OPVR EMI reduction can be achieved by increasing RFI Spread Spectrum % value. The use of spread Spectrum % value larger than 1.5% may introduce Wi-Fi RFI. Check Wi-Fi (2.4GHz-2.5GH) RFI condition.
knob.depex: Sif( McivrSupported _EQU_ 0 AND FivrSupported _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( FivrSupported _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/CPU VR Settings/RFI Settings/RFI Spread Spectrum

knob.name: PowerLimit3Override
knob.description: Enable/DisablePower Limit 3 override. If this option is disabled, BIOS will leave the hardware default values for Power Limit 3 and Power Limit 3 Time Window.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Power Limit 3 Settings/Power Limit 3 Override

knob.name: PowerLimit3
knob.description: Power Limit 3 in Milli Watts. BIOS will round to the nearest 1/8W when programming. For 12.50W, enter 12500. XE SKU: Any value can be programmed. Overclocking SKU: Value must be between Max and Min Power Limits (specified by PACKAGE_POWER_SKU_MSR). Other SKUs: This value must be between Min Power Limit and TDP Limit. If the value is 0, BIOS leaves the hardware default value
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Power Limit 3 Settings/Power Limit 3

knob.name: PowerLimit3Time
knob.description: Power Limit 3 Time Window value in Milli seconds. The value may vary from 3 to 64(max).Indicates the time window over which Power Limit 3 value should be maintained. If the value is 0, BIOS leaves the hardware default value
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Power Limit 3 Settings/Power Limit 3 Time Window

knob.name: PowerLimit3DutyCycle
knob.description: Specify the duty cycle in percentage that the CPU is required to maintain over the configured time window. Range is 0-100.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Power Limit 3 Settings/Powet Limit 3 Duty Cycle

knob.name: PowerLimit3Lock
knob.description: Power Limit 3 MSR 615h Lock. When enabled PL3 configurations are locked during OS. When disabled PL3 configuration can be changed during OS.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/Power Limit 3 Settings/Power Limit 3 Lock

knob.name: ConfigTdpLevel
knob.description: Configurable TDP Mode as Nominal/Up/Down/Deactivate TDP selection. Deactivate option will set MSR to Nominal and MMIO to Zero.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ Config TDP Configurations/Configurable TDP Boot Mode

knob.name: ConfigTdpLevel_inst_2
knob.description: Configurable TDP Mode as Nominal/Up/Down/Deactivate TDP selection. Deactivate option will set MSR to Nominal and MMIO to Zero.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ Config TDP Configurations/Configurable TDP Boot Mode

knob.name: ConfigTdpLevel_inst_3
knob.description: Configurable TDP Mode as Nominal/Up/Down/Deactivate TDP selection. Deactivate option will set MSR to Nominal and MMIO to Zero.
knob.depex: Sif( ConfigTdpAvailable _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( CtdpDownSupported _EQU_ 0 OR CtdpUpSupported _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ Config TDP Configurations/Configurable TDP Boot Mode

knob.name: ConfigTdpLock
knob.description: Configurable TDP Mode Lock sets the Lock bits on TURBO_ACTIVATION_RATIO and CONFIG_TDP_CONTROL. Note: When CTDP Lock is enabled Custom ConfigTDP Count will be forced to 1 and Custom ConfigTDP Boot Index will be forced to 0.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ Config TDP Configurations/Configurable TDP Lock

knob.name: ConfigTdpBios
knob.description: Enables CTDP control via runtime ACPI BIOS methods. This ?BIOS only? feature does not require EC or driver support.
knob.depex: Sif( ConfigTdpAvailable _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( ConfigTdpLock _EQU_ 1 OR EnableDptf _EQU_ 1 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ Config TDP Configurations/CTDP BIOS control

knob.description: Power Limit 1 in Milli Watts. BIOS will round to the nearest 1/8W when programming. 0 - no custom override. For 12.50W, enter 12500. Overclocking SKU: Value must be between Max and Min Power Limits (specified by PACKAGE_POWER_SKU_MSR). Other SKUs: This value must be between Min Power Limit and TDP Limit.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ Config TDP Configurations/Power Limit 1

knob.name: Custom1PowerLimit2Power

knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ Config TDP Configurations/Power Limit 2

knob.description: Power Limit 1 Time Window value in seconds. The value may vary from 0 to 128. 0 - use default value (28 sec). Defines time window which TDP value should be maintained.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Power n Performance/CPU - Power Management Control/ Config TDP Configurations/Power Limit 1 Time Window

knob.name: PchCnviMode
knob.description: This option configures Connectivity. [Auto Detection] means that if Discrete solution is discovered it will be enabled by default. Otherwise Integrated solution (CNVi) will be enabled; [Disable Integrated] disables Integrated Solution. NOTE: When CNVi is present, the GPIO pins that are used for radio interface cannot be assigned to the other native function.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/ CNVi Mode

knob.name: PchCnviMfUart1Type
knob.description: This is a test option which allows configuration of UART type for WiFi side band communication
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/ MfUart1 type

knob.name: CoExistenceManager
knob.description: CoEx Manager mitigates radio coexistence issues between Intel WWAN (modem) and Intel WLAN (WiFi/BT). This should be enabled only if both WWAN and WLAN solutions are based on Intel components
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/CoExistence Manager

knob.name: PrebootBleEnable
knob.description: This will be used to enable Preboot Bluetooth function
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/Preboot BLE

knob.name: BleReconnectionDelay
knob.description: Delay prior to connecting BLE host controller. Value between 0-1000ms. Default is 100ms
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/ BLE Reconnection Delay

knob.name: DiscreteBtModule
knob.description: SerialIo UART0 needs to be enabled to select BT Module

knob.name: DiscreteBtModuleIrqMode
knob.description: Selects routing of interrupt from BT Module

knob.name: WifiEnable
knob.description: Configure ACPI objects for wireless devices
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/Advanced settings

knob.name: AntennaDiversity
knob.description: This allows WiFi modules which have only one antenna to use one of the 2 possible antennas with the options: 0 - Antenna1 1 - Antenna2 2 - Diversity 3 - Diversity Antenna1 4 - Diversity Antenna2
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/Switched Antenna Diversity Selection

knob.name: WifiDomainType1

knob.name: WifiPowerLimit1

knob.name: BluetoothSar
knob.description: Define the mode of SAR control to be used. Disabled: Tx power shall be mandated by device NVM Enabled: Tx power shall be the minimum between BIOS SAR table and BT Device NVM (either Module or Platform)

knob.name: WwanResetWorkaround
knob.description: Enabling this workardound will result in BIOS asserting FULL_CARD_POWER_OFF#, PERST# and RESET# WWAN signals before the WWAN Device Power-On Sequence is executed. Disabling it has no impact.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/WWAN Configuration/WWAN Reset Workaround

knob.name: WdtEnable
knob.description: Enable/Disable WatchDog Timer. Note: This option is ignored on debug BIOS.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/WDT Enable

knob.name: XtuInterfaceEnable
knob.description: Enable/Disable XTU Interface. BIOS will only expose XTU interface when enabled.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/XTU Interface

knob.name: BclkAdaptiveVoltageEnable
knob.description: BCLK Aware Adaptive Voltage enable/disable. When enabled, pcode will be aware of the BCLK frequency when calculating the CPU V/F curves. This is ideal for BCLK OC to avoid high voltage overrides. Uses OC Mailbox command 0x15.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/BCLK Aware Adaptive Voltage

knob.name: CoreMaxOcRatio
knob.description: Sets the maximum OC Ratio for the CPU Core. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11. Range 0-255.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Core Max OC Ratio

knob.name: CoreVoltageMode
knob.description: Selects between Adaptive and Override Voltage modes. In Override Mode the voltage selected will be applied over all operating frequencies. In Adaptive Mode the voltage is interpolated only in turbo mode. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Core Voltage Mode

knob.name: CoreVoltageOverride
knob.description: Specifies the Override Voltage applied to the IA Core domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range 0-2000 mV.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( CoreVoltageMode _EQU_ 0x0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Core Voltage Override

knob.name: CoreExtraTurboVoltage
knob.description: Specifies the extra turbo voltage applied while IA Core is operating in turbo mode. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11. Range 0-2000 mV
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( CoreVoltageMode _EQU_ 0x1 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Core Extra Turbo Voltage

knob.name: CoreVoltageOffset
knob.description: Specifies the Offset Voltage applied to the IA Core domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range -500 to 500 mV
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Core Voltage Offset

knob.name: CoreVoltageOffsetPrefix
knob.description: Sets the offset value as positive or negative.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/ Offset Prefix

knob.name: Avx2RatioOffset
knob.description: AVX2 Ratio Offset. Specifies number of bins to decrease AVX ratio vs. Core Ratio. AVX is a more stressful workload, it is helpful to lower the AVX ratio to ensure maximum possible ratio for SSE workloads. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x1B. Range 0 - 31. 0 - No offset.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/AVX2 Ratio Offset

knob.name: TjMaxOffset
knob.description: TjMax Offset. Specified value here is clipped by pCode (125 - TjMax Offset) to support TjMax in the range of 62 to 115 deg Celsius. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x37, command 0x01. Range 10 - 63. 0 - No offset. Only valid on CFL-S 8+2.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/TjMax Offset

knob.name: TvbRatioClipping
knob.description: This service controls Core frequency reduction caused by high package temperatures for processors that implement the Intel Thermal Velocity Boost (TVB) feature. It is required to be disabled for supporting overclocking at frequencies higher than the default max turbo frequency. Default is disabled. Uses Overclocking Mailbox command 0x18/0x19.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/TVB Ratio Clipping

knob.name: TvbVoltageOptimization
knob.description: This service controls thermal based voltage optimizations for processors that implement the Intel Thermal Velocity Boost (TVB) feature. Default is enabled. Uses Overclocking Mailbox command 0x18/0x19.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/TVB Voltage Optimizations

knob.name: RingMaxOcRatio
knob.description: Sets the maximum OC Ratio for the CPU Ring. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11. Range 0-255.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Ring/Ring Max OC Ratio

knob.name: RingDownBin
knob.description: Enable/Disable Ring Downbin feature. Enabled - CPU will down bin the ring ratio, which means the requested max ring ratio will not be observed. Disable - CPU will not down bin the ring ratio and the requested ring ratio limit will be observed. Default for Overclocking is ?Disabled? to allow for a predictable ring ratio. Uses OC mailbox command 0x19.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Ring/Ring Down Bin

knob.name: MinRingRatioLimit
knob.description: This sets the minimum ring ratio limit. 0 - Auto/HW default. 1-LFM are invalid ratio settings.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Ring/Min Ring Ratio Limit

knob.name: MaxRingRatioLimit
knob.description: This sets the maximum ring ratio limit. 0 - Auto/HW default. 1-LFM are invalid ratio settings.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( PlatformType _EQU_ 0x2 ) _AND_ Sif( OverclockingSupport _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Ring/Max Ring Ratio Limit

knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/System Agent (SA) Configuration/Above 4GB MMIO BIOS assignment

knob.name: X2ApicOptOut
knob.description: Enable/Disable X2APIC_OPT_OUT bit
knob.depex: Gif( VTdAvailable _EQU_ 0 OR EnableVtd _EQU_ 0 ) _AND_ Sif( LocalX2ApicAvailable _EQU_ 0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/System Agent (SA) Configuration/X2APIC Opt Out

knob.name: GfxTurboIMON

knob.name: PrimaryDisplay
knob.description: Select which of IGFX/PEG/PCI Graphics device should be Primary Display Or select SG for Switchable Gfx.
knob.depex: Sif( ( PlatformType _NEQ_ 0x1 ) OR ( ( PlatformFlavor _NEQ_ 0x1 ) AND ( PlatformFlavor _NEQ_ 0x5 ) AND ( PlatformFlavor _NEQ_ 0x2 ) AND ( PlatformFlavor _NEQ_ 0x3 ) ) )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/System Agent (SA) Configuration/Graphics Configuration/Primary Display

knob.name: PcieCardSelect
knob.description: Select the card used on the platform Auto : Skip GPIO based Power Enable to dGPU Elk Creek 4: DGPU Power Enable - ActiveLow PEG Eval : DGPU Power Enable - ActiveHigh
knob.depex: Sif( ( PlatformType _NEQ_ 0x1 ) OR ( ( PlatformFlavor _NEQ_ 0x1 ) AND ( PlatformFlavor _NEQ_ 0x5 ) AND ( PlatformFlavor _NEQ_ 0x2 ) AND ( PlatformFlavor _NEQ_ 0x3 ) ) )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/System Agent (SA) Configuration/Graphics Configuration/Select PCIE Card

knob.name: PrimaryDisplay_inst_2
knob.description: Select which of IGFX/PEG/PCI Graphics device should be Primary Display Or select SG for Switchable Gfx.

knob.name: PcieCardSelect_inst_2

knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/System Agent (SA) Configuration/PEG Port Configuration/PEG IMR

knob.name: PegImrSize
knob.description: PEG Reserved Memory Size to be requested in MB. Maximum value of 1024 MB Value should be 2 power N, where N-0 to 10

knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/System Agent (SA) Configuration/PEG Port Configuration/PEG IMR Size

knob.name: IgdBootType
knob.description: Select the Video Device which will be activated during POST. This has no effect if external graphics present. Secondary boot display selection will appear based on your selection. VGA modes will be supported only on primary display
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformFlavor _EQU_ 0x4 OR CsmControl _EQU_ 1 OR CsmControl _EQU_ 2 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/System Agent (SA) Configuration/Graphics Configuration/LCD Control/Primary IGFX Boot Display

knob.name: DisplayPipeB
knob.description: Select Secondary Display Device
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformFlavor _EQU_ 0x4 OR CsmControl _EQU_ 1 OR CsmControl _EQU_ 2 ) _AND_ Sif( IgdBootType _EQU_ 0x0 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/System Agent (SA) Configuration/Graphics Configuration/LCD Control/Secondary IGFX Boot Display

knob.name: LcdPanelType
knob.description: Select LCD panel used by Internal Graphics Device by selecting the appropriate setup item.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformFlavor _EQU_ 0x4 OR CsmControl _EQU_ 1 OR CsmControl _EQU_ 2 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/System Agent (SA) Configuration/Graphics Configuration/LCD Control/LCD Panel Type

knob.name: LcdPanelScaling
knob.description: Select the LCD panel scaling option used by the Internal Graphics Device.
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformFlavor _EQU_ 0x4 OR CsmControl _EQU_ 1 OR CsmControl _EQU_ 2 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/System Agent (SA) Configuration/Graphics Configuration/LCD Control/Panel Scaling

knob.name: IgdLcdBlc
knob.description: Back Light Control Setting
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformFlavor _EQU_ 0x4 OR CsmControl _EQU_ 1 OR CsmControl _EQU_ 2 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/System Agent (SA) Configuration/Graphics Configuration/LCD Control/Backlight Control

knob.name: ActiveLFP
knob.description: Select the Active LFP Configuration. No LVDS:VBIOS does not enable LVDS. Int-LVDS:VBIOS enables LVDS driver by Integrated encoder. SDVO LVDS:VBIOS enables LVDS driver by SDVO encoder. eDP Port-A:LFP Driven by Int-DisplayPort encoder from Port-A. eDP Port-D:LFP Driven by Int-DisplayPort encoder from Port-D(through PCH).
knob.depex: Sif( PlatformFlavor _EQU_ 0x4 OR CsmControl _EQU_ 1 OR CsmControl _EQU_ 2 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/System Agent (SA) Configuration/Graphics Configuration/LCD Control/Active LFP

knob.name: LfpColorDepth

knob.depex: Sif( PlatformFlavor _EQU_ 0x4 OR CsmControl _EQU_ 1 OR CsmControl _EQU_ 2 )
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/System Agent (SA) Configuration/Graphics Configuration/LCD Control/Panel Color Depth

knob.name: VbiosBrightness

knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/System Agent (SA) Configuration/Graphics Configuration/LCD Control/Backlight Brightness
